intro: Urera corallina, commonly known as coral urera, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean islands. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers that bloom in the summer months. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Urera corallina is typically found in moist, shaded areas within tropical forests.
